intro: Plocoglottis bokorensis, commonly known as the Bokorensis fern, is a rare and endemic species native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows as a epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its small, clustered spore-producing structures are an important feature for its reproductive cycle. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
